<@US74TEQ3E>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Potential issue with data passing incorrecting for dog death`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Description:* `It’s been flagged a few times now that HF employees who canceled their TPT account due to their dog passing have been receiving reactivation emails when they shouldn’t be.
In SFMC, we've set up to suppress anyone whose cancellation_reason is listed as “dog death” or “dog passed away” from receiving email communications. However, when I checked SFMC for these customers, their cancel reason was listed as something else which is why they’re still receiving emails. I’m wondering if the correct data isn’t being captured on the backend, which could be why it’s showing incorrectly in SFMC. Can we look into this?`
*Expected behaviour:* `cancellation reason to show "death" or "my dog passed away" `
*Actual behaviour:* `cancellation reason showing as a different cancel reason`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue
attachments.text:

In SFMC, we've set up to suppress anyone whose cancellation_reason is listed as “dog death” or “dog passed away” from receiving email communications. However, when I checked SFMC for these customers, their cancel reason was listed as something else which is why they’re still receiving emails. _thread_replies.text:
Expected behavior: Former F4L subscriptions *should not have F4L addons selected on their menus on reactivation*. If the selection persists
• users cannot see the F4L item on the meal selection UI, as menu endpoint does not return free add-ons if no benefits available (F4L benefit gets removed on cancellation of subscription), but it is selected on the user menu
• users will receive the add-on and will be fully charged for it
This is handled through a combination of FE and BE workarounds with some edge cases. You can find more about those on this thread

<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C063ZN1J5J6/p1727689762978219>

elements.text: Hi

,
A question regarding the solution for
Full-Priced Free Add-ons – Subscription Cancelation (
to delete all free add-on selections on subscription cancelation event

Does this solution cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well? As in PetsTable all the addons are subscribable, including the F4L addons.
If not, is it possible to extend the solution to cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well?

attachments.fallback:
[September 30th, 2024 2:49 AM] gsun: Hi :wave:,
A question regarding the solution for *Full-Priced Free Add-ons – Subscription Cancelation (*to delete all free add-on selections on subscription cancelation event*).* 

Does this solution cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well? As in PetsTable all the addons are subscribable, including the F4L addons.
If not, is it possible to extend the solution to cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well?
attachments.text:
Hi :wave:,
A question regarding the solution for *Full-Priced Free Add-ons – Subscription Cancelation (*to delete all free add-on selections on subscription cancelation event*).* 

Does this solution cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well? As in PetsTable all the addons are subscribable, including the F4L addons.
If not, is it possible to extend the solution to cover the subscribable add-ons selection as well?

elements.text: Expected behavior: Former F4L subscriptions
should not have F4L addons selected on their menus on reactivation
. If the selection persists

users cannot see the F4L item on the meal selection UI, as menu endpoint does not return free add-ons if no benefits available (F4L benefit gets removed on cancellation of subscription), but it is selected on the user menu
users will receive the add-on and will be fully charged for it
This is handled through a combination of FE and BE workarounds with some edge cases. You can find more about those on this thread

_thread_replies.text:
FE logic: <https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/store/src/customer/subscription/unsubscribe-addons-before-deactivation/unsubscribeAddOnsBeforeDeactivation.ts#L40|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitel[…]dons-before-deactivation/unsubscribeAddOnsBeforeDeactivation.ts>

BE logic: Based on the <https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C07EWJZGXQ9/p1727439172358199?thread_ts=1727430312.560989&cid=C07EWJZGXQ9|last received confirmation>, BE logic uses the following SKU pattern to remove all the selections on cancellation `%S-AFC-0-0-0`. Would be good to align with the respective BE team if the SKU pattern differs

elements.text:
The way it works currently is that we delete add-on selections based on SKU.
The SKU needs to follow the pattern
to work
